info.title: Conversion Definition API
info.description: This REST API allows you to perform actions such as adding, changing, and deleting the conversion definitions.

port.description: The port to which the server is listening.

/add.summary: Use this path to add a new conversion definition.
/add.description: Use this path to add a new conversion definition.

post.summary: Use this operation to add a new conversion definition.
post.description: Use this operation to add a new conversion definition.

requestBody.description: Use this input schema to add the new conversion definition.

addConversionDefinition.summary: How to specify the add request input parameters value.

/change.summary: use this schema to change the conversion definition.
/change.description: use this schema to change the conversion definition.

post.summary: Use this operation to change the conversion definition.
post.description: Use this operation to change the conversion definition.

requestBody.description: use this path to change the conversion definition.

changeConversionDefinition.summary: How to specify the change request input parameters value.

/delete.summary: use this path to delete the conversion definition.
/delete.description: use this path to delete the conversion definition.

post.summary: use this operation to delete the conversion definition.
post.description: use this operation to delete the conversion definition.

requestBody.description: use this path to delete the conversion definition.

deleteConversionDefinition.summary: How to specify the delete request input parameters value.

messageType.description: The message type 'E' indicates an error message, 'W' indicates a warning, while a blank indicates a normal message with no error.

applicationCode.description:
Specify the application code.
                                                         
A blank value is not allowed in the application code field.

conversionType.description:
The data conversion type instructs OMS what action must be taken on the data in a physical file. Default conversion will be performed by OMS if no conversion type is defined for a specific physical file: The contents of the replaced
physical file will be copied to the newly created physical using the *MAP and *DROP parameters.                      

The possible values are: 

1=Including data (*DATA)                               
    The object will be copied as will the data it contains, thus replacing existing data members. Use this value for physical files containing changed parameter values.                                  

2=Without data (*NODATA)                                 
    The object will be copied without the data it contains, thus creating a empty file.                
                                                         
8=Call user program (*USRPGM)                            
    A user conversion program which can be defined in the OMS conversion file (See technical description below) will be called after the physical file has been created.                                           

9=Convert from other file (*OTHOBJ)                                    
    Standard conversion will be executed, though not from an equally amed physical file but from a physical file with a different name.

Technical description                                             
A user program is called using the following parameters for type '8'(*USRPGM). All parameters are character fields:                
Parameter   Description (length)                                     
                                                                     
FENV        The From-environment code (C5)                           
                                                                     
FOBC        The From-object code; the physical file with data (C10)  
                                                                     
FOBL        The library of the physical file to be copied (C10)      
                                                                     
TENV        The To-environment code (C5)                             
                                                                     
TOBJ        The To-object code; the newly created physical file (C10)
                                                                     
TOBL        To library of the newly created physical file (C10)      
                                                                     
STAT        The status after converting the data (C5). Use the value '*NORM' for normal ending of program and '*TERM' for abnormal ending.

ignoreWarning.description:
Specify the ignore warnings indicator. The possible values are:
                                                               
*NO                                                            
    Use this value if you want to show warning messages.       
                                                               
*YES                                                           
    Use this value if you do not want to show warning messages.

updateDb.description: Specify '1' to update the database or '0' to not update but check only.

updateBuffer.description: Specify '1' to update the returned data with the lastest values or '0' to not return the latest data.

addRequest.description: Request data to add the conversion definition

addProcessingOptions.description: Enter processing array input here to add the conversion definition.

changeProcessingOptions.description: Enter processing array input here to change the conversion definition.

deleteProcessingOptions.description: Enter processing array input here to delete the conversion definition.

changeRequest.description: Request data to change the conversion definition.

deleteRequest.description: Request data to delete the conversion definition.

status.description: returns the status of the api request.

response.description: This will return the response data.

responseData.description: contains the file fields for response.

errorResponse.description: This will return the error information.

memberCode.description: Use this prompt to enter a specific member name if a single member is connected to a fix, not the physical file itself.  The value *ALL must be used if a physical file is connected to a fix.

programName.description:
Specify the conversion program name and the library for the conversion definition. Blank values are not allowed.                                
                                                                         
Qualifier 1: conversion program name                                     
    Use this value in combination with conversion type *USRPGM to enter the object code of the conversion program to be called.              
                                                                         
*SAME                                                                    
    Use this value to indicate that conversion program name does not change. In *ADD mode, this value is not allowed.                     
                                                                         
    In *change this value is allowed only if database does not have a blank value.

programLibrary.description:
Use this value in combination with conversion type *USRPGM to enter  the object code library of the conversion program to be called.     
                                                                        
*SAME                                                                   
    Use this value to indicate that conversion library name does not change. In *ADD mode, this value is not allowed.                    
                                                                        
    In *change this value is allowed only if database does not have a blank value.                

*LIBL                                                                   
    Use this value to indicate that conversion program will be referred from the library list.

referenceObject.description:
Use this prompt in combination with conversion type *OTHOBJ to enter the related object code. This must be a physical file which will be used to copy the data from.                                                     
                                                                        
*SAME                                                                   
    Use this value to indicate that related object code does not change. In *ADD mode, this value is not allowed.                            
                                                                        
    In *change this value is allowed only if database does not have a blank value.

objectCode.description: Use this prompt to enter the object code of the physical file you are defining the conversion for. A blank value is not allowed.
